doc.abstracts: On August 14 and October 16 and 21, 1991, Benjamin B. King was was interviewed by the Brookings Institution on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by John Lewis, Richard Webb, and Devesh Kapur. During his tenure at the Bank from 1947 to 1981, Mr. King worked in the following areas: as chief economist (1968-1969); in the economic program department as senior advisor (1972-1974); as an advisor to the Canadian International Development Agency (1972-1974); as a research advisor to the vice president of development (1974-1977); in the development economics department as director (1978-1981); and as acting vice president for economics and research staff (1987).
